en: The project has been downloaded. Select the page you want to get frames from.
Opening authorization page in the web browser…
Getting links to download images: {0} of {1}

Download Figma project from URL.
The current active import of the current canvas will be stopped.

Import selected frames from a downloaded or cached Figma project.
The current active import of the current canvas will be stopped.
The current version of the asset.
The name of the user authorized in the current instance of the asset.
The ID of the user authorized in the current instance of the asset.
No frames found. If you are using Sections, place them inside a frame using the "Frame selection" function in Figma, and try the import again.
The ID of this asset instance.
The number of downloaded kilobytes of the current download object.
The token is needed for the working of the asset, it is used to send api requests to Figma.
Link to your project in Figma.
Format of images imported from Figma.
The size of the images imported from Figma.
A text component to be used when wrapping text from Figma. Currently 'Unity.UI.Text' and 'TextMeshPro' are supported.
The type of shadow that is used when transferring the shadow effect from Figma. Currently the 'TrueShadow' asset is supported, you can also turn off the shadow.
Whether to add 'I2Localize' script to 'Unity.UI.Text' or 'TextMeshPro' component.
[Obsolete] If enabled, the downloadable images will replace those that were downloaded earlier when old downloading.
Feature for developers. Allows to save the received response from Figma in json format.
Should Unity ignore the size properties and simply try to fit the text to the control's rectangle?
The vertical separation between lines of text.
The method used to handle the situation where the text is too wide to fit in the rectangle. The options are Wrap and Overflow.
The method used to handle the situation where wrapped text is too tall to fit in the rectangle. The options are Truncate and Overflow.
Auto sizes the text to fit the available space.
Whether the color settings override the <color> tag.
Wraps text to the next line when reaching the edge of the container.
Enables the use of rich text tags such as <color> and <font>.
Whether the text blocks raycasts from the Graphic Raycaster.
Whether to display strings such as \"\\n\" as is or replace them by the character they represent.
Compute descender values from visible characters only. Used to adjust layout behavior when hiding and revealing characters dynamically.
Enables character specific spacing between pairs of characters.
Adds some padding between the characters and the edge of the text mesh. Can reduce graphical errors when displaying small text.
How to display text which goes past the edge of the container.
Horizontal UV mapping when using a shader with a texture face option.
Vertical UV mapping when using a shader with a texture face option.
The order in which text geometry is sorted. Used to adjust the way overlapping characters are displayed.

Either this file doesn’t exist or you don’t have permission to view it. Ask the file owner to verify the link and/or update permissions. If you are using a team project, read the 'Teamwork' section in 'Manual for designers.pdf'.

Remove sprites from the selected folder that are not used by
Image components in the current open scene.
You can learn more about this script in the dev manual, 'Layout updating' slide.
Don't remove this script until you are done with the layout.

Add TTF fonts from selected folder
Add TMP fonts from selected folder

You have enabled the '{0}' function.
In current version of the asset this function is under development and may work with errors.
When enabled, importing the full structure of your layout, without smart-combine multiple sprites into one sprite.
The components that will be created on your Canvas when you import the project.

Specify the space, in pixels, between characters in the font texture.

Padding provides the space required to render character separately, and to generate the SDF gradient (See the documentation on Font Assets for details).

The larger the padding, the smoother the transition, which allows for higher-quality rendering and larger effects, like thick outlines.

A padding of 5 is often fine for a 512x512 texture.
Specify the render mode to use when outputting the font atlas.

Set the size width and height of the font texture, in pixels.

A resolution of 512 x 512 is fine for most fonts, as long as you are only including ASCII characters. Fonts with more characters may require larger resolutions, or multiple atlases.

When using an SDF font, a higher resolution produces finer gradients, and therefore higher quality text.
TextMeshPro font generation settings, identical to the settings of the 'Font Asset Creator' utility.
In order for the asset to be able to automatically download missing fonts, you need to create your own '{0}', and enter it in '{0}' field.

A Font Subset is a sequence (Unicode-Range) of Unicode hexadecimal values, or ranges of values, to specify which characters to include in your font file.

Google supports several subsets for different language groups that are passed to the 'Font Asset Creator' utility when creating a TMP font.

To change the range after font generation, open your TMP font asset in the Inspector and click on the 'Update Atlas Texture' button.

A hyphen is used to separate the first and last values in a range.
Commas are used to separate values and ranges (for example, '20-7E,A0,2026', where '2026' code is ellipsis (…)).

two texts using the '{0}' button
and copy the properties of the two objects that you see below

Failed to generate {0} fonts, you need to generate them manually: {1}

In this tab, you can set links to Figma projects that contain your master components.
This is usually necessary if the asset cannot access sprites that are part of a
component instance whose master component is not in the main project.
Unable to download some images. You may need to add links to Figma projects with your master components in the '{0}' tab.
Asset '{0}' was not imported. You can find it in the Asset Store or Package Manager.
This feature is available in version Unity {0} and above.

A backup of your scene is created at the path:
{0}
Sets the value of the "Layout" parameter, which you can see in the top-right corner of the Inspector, for all the GameObjects being instantiated.

Unity doesn't allow establishing an HTTP connection.
To proceed with the import, open Project Settings > Player > Configuration, and switch the 'Allow downloads over HTTP' option to 'Always allowed'.

Your project exceeds the allowable size. Import stopped.
Project size: {0} MB.
Allowable size: {1} MB.
Please move the frames you want to import into a new project and try the import again.
{0}: has differences. '{1}' in Unity. '{2}' in Figma.
All components - those that exist on the scene and those that exist in Figma (without duplicates).
Components that are missing on the scene but exist in Figma.

Components whose hash, saved in the SyncHelper object at the time of the previous import, differs from the hash obtained before the new import as a result of analyzing the same component in Figma.
The component hash is a hash of the aggregate values of all properties of that component in Figma.

Components whose properties have been changed in the Unity Inspector.
Currently, tracking of two properties is supported: color and size.
Components that will be removed from the scene.
Components that will be added to the scene or updated if they already exist on the scene.

AutoSize is not supported when Overflow is in 'OVERFLOW' mode.
You will be able to enable AutoSize if you switch Overflow to another mode, but in that case, some of your text components may have incorrect size or coordinates in the current version of the asset.
How many pixels in the sprite correspond to one unit in the world.
